newsitem.title: UK: GEC says amends Simpson's pay package.
newsitem.headline: GEC says amends Simpson's pay package.

text.p: British defence and engineering group General Electric Company (GEC) said on Monday it has amended the terms of new managing director George Simpson's remuneration package.

GEC's share price must now exceed by at least 10 percent the growth in the FTSE 100 index over a three year period for Simpson to receive a huge block of shares, instead of the six months as previously agreed, the company said in a statement.
"GEC and Mr Simpson have always envisaged that challenging performance criteria would be attached to awards made to Mr Simpson under the GEC employee share plan," it said.
"GEC is pleased to confirm that the criteria will comply with Association of British Insurers' current guidelines."
Sources said earlier the company had proposed draft changes after meeting the ABI's investment affairs head Richard Regan.
Simpson has accepted the amendment to his contract.
The meeting with the ABI had been called after shareholders expressed concern over the terms of Simpson's proposed 10 million stg pay package.
His three year contract includes annual pay of up to 1.5 million stg, including pension contributions and share options.
Investors Norwich Union and Prudential Corp were not immediately available to comment.
Last week, mutually-owned insurer Norwich Union said it had not discarded the possibility of voting against Simpson's appointment at the company's annual meeting on September 6.
